March 2020 – Present		Account Manager (Portfolio) - Midlands, Cole-Parmer, St Neots.
I am responsible for:
Managing customer accounts from Lancaster to Milton Keynes and Oxford to include quoting customers and solving problems plus following up on marketing campaigns.

August 2018 – March 2020	North Europe Sales Manager, A&D Instruments, Abingdon
I was responsible for:
Sales and Marketing of the full range of Analytical, Precision and Moisture Balances, Industrial Scales, Counting Scales and Loadcells with a number of Laboratory Suppliers and Calibration companies across the UK, Ireland and Scandinavia.
Channel Management of a number of Global and Pan-European distributors at a corporate level.
Providing demonstrations of all kit to end users in Biopharma, Bioprocessing, Industrial and Academia accounts.
Implementation and updating of the new CRM system.
Attending exhibitions and conferences to promote products.
Assisting the Sales Director with setting the European Sales Strategy and implementing it for my region.
January 2017 – July 2018	Capital Equipment Specialist, VWR International, Lutterworth
I was responsible for:
Sales and Marketing of Laboratory Equipment and Service and Calibration services to a number of laboratories including Hospitals, Universities, Industrial, Biotech and Pharma labs across the North West of England and North Wales.
Attending exhibitions and conferences to promote products.
Working with the Suppliers to ensure we were promoting their products and to receive technical training of over approximately 50,000 equipment items.
July 2014 – December 2016	Account Manager, VWR International, Lutterworth
I was responsible for:
Sales and Marketing of Laboratory consumables, chemicals and reagents, equipment, PPE and also services to a number of laboratories including Hospitals, Universities, Industrial, Biotech and Pharma labs.
Maintaining existing accounts in Yorkshire.
Attending exhibitions and conferences to promote products.
Working with our Suppliers to ensure we are promoting their products and updating our portfolio of over 2.5million products.
Assisting our Sales Team in the North of England as a Healthcare Sales Specialist.
As part of my role as an Account Manager, I worked alongside our team of Sales Specialists to make sure we were working with our customers to offer them a complete solution and to try and help them make their purchasing experience easier.  As a Healthcare Sales Specialist, I also managed the major contracts we have with NHS Supply Chain and Managed Service companies such as Roche, Abbott and Genmed as well as assisting our Sales team in all aspects on sales into the Hospitals.
September 2013 – July 2014	Senior Sales Executive, PeproTech Ltd, London
I was responsible for:
Sales and Marketing of Recombinant Growth Factors i.e. Cytokines, Antibodies and ELISA Kits.
Maintaining existing accounts in the North of England, Scotland and Ireland.
Attending exhibitions, conferences and Seminars to promote products.
Maintaining the company CRM by adding, updating and “cleaning” my customers’ records.
I was only with PeproTech a short time didn’t get a full year of sales data; however, I did see increases in business in the major accounts of Manchester, Edinburgh and Glasgow.  I sold into University Laboratories and I dealt with a range of Researchers and Technical Staff; Professors, Principle Investigators, Post Doctoral Researchers, PhD Students, Lab Managers, Lab Technicians and Procurement Officers.
March 2011 – May 2013	Business Sales Executive, Fannin UK, Wellingborough
I was responsible for:
Sales and Marketing of Peripheral IV Access devices including Needle Free Access Devices, Cannulas, PICC’s and Implantable Ports.
Maintaining existing accounts in Cheshire, Merseyside, Lancashire, Gtr. Manchester and Yorkshire.
Attending exhibitions and conferences to promote products.
Assisting with trial and installations on Intensive Therapy Units, Neonatal Units, Haematology/Oncology Wards & Departments and Cancer Centres and also Operating Theatres.
Whilst with Fannin, I had successes in securing major accounts including the Liverpool Heart & Chest Hospital, which after only 4 months with the company is an internal record for the product group, the Royal Liverpool University Hospital, Alder Hey Hospital and University Hospital of North Staffs. I increased sales in my first year of 26%, with new business in excess of £40k, with 2 of my product groups running at 148% and one at 136% and last year I achieved a 20% increase, bringing in approximately £50k of new business.
June 2008 – March 2011 	Territory Manager, Sunlight Clinical Solutions, Basingstoke
I was responsible for:
Sales and marketing of Drapes and Gowns, Custom Procedure Packs and Instruments into various Operating Theatres, including Ophthalmic, Orthopaedic and General Surgery, and CSSD/HSDU.
Maintaining existing accounts in , Merseyside, ,  and .
Attending exhibitions and conferences to promote products.
Assisting with trials and installations in Operating Theatres.
My main achievement with Sunlight was me being awarded the Sunlight Elite Award after only 5 months with the company which resulted in me being given a trip to Cape Town, South Africa with the other top performers in the other divisions on the Sunlight Service Group. I secured large contracts at Manchester Royal Eye Hospital, Stepping Hill Hospital Ophthalmic Theatres, The Pennine Trust, Royal Liverpool University Hospital NHS Trust and also Central Manchester & Manchester Children’s Hospitals NHS Trust.  In my final year with the company I signed off business to the value of approx. £450K (full year value) and also secured another contract which eventually was worth in excess of £300K (full year value).
December 2000 – June 2008	Sales Representative, Sarstedt Ltd, Leicester
I was responsible for:
Sales and marketing of blood collection systems, transfusion & anaesthetic products and urology products. Also sold a range of Capital Equipment into the Blood Transfusion market.
Maintaining existing accounts in , Merseyside, , ,  and .
Attending exhibitions and conferences to promote products.
Assisting in the training of products with Consultants, Doctors, Anaesthetists and Nursing staff over 3 different product ranges.
Mentoring new employees and also as a Senior Representative, assisting Management with on-going support with the less experienced members of the sales team.
At Sarstedt, my main achievements were me winning two major contracts for the Blood Collection system at East Lancashire NHS Trust and also at The Christie NHS Trust. I also increased Sales in the territory from £1.45M to approx £2M in my time with the company. I also acted as an official mentor for several people including other Representatives and also Product Specialists. I was the first ever person appointed for this role and the companies official mentor is the Representative I first mentored.

Senior Technician - Research & Development
I was responsible for:
Research & Development of new and existing products for the 3 companies in the group; Janitorial, Laundry and Pharmaceutical and general laboratory duties.

Visiting potential customers to evaluate problems and developing new products to the customer’s specification.
